task_description: Facing the building to your North (approx. 14°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: To estimate the building's height, I need to see its top; rotating up will reveal the roofline for height calculation.
To measure the full height, I need to see both the base and roof; pitching down to 0° will reveal the ground level for height calculation.

Having observed both the building's base (at 30° down) and roof (previously at 30° up), the total vertical angle span of ~60° suggests a typical multi-story building height of approximately 20 meters.
